method.name: emulation_pcc_config
method.description: This procedure will add PCC(s) to a particular Ixia Interface. The user can then configure, PCC by using the procedure PCC Requested SR LSPs, Pre-Established SR LSPs and Expected PCE Initiated SR LSPs for Traffic.

description.text: This option defines whether to Create/Modify/Delete/Enable/Disable PCC and different types of LSPs under PCC.

choice.choiceText: Creates a PCC and different types of LSPs under PCC.
Modifies a PCC and different types of LSPs under PCC.
Enables a PCC and different types of LSPs under PCC.
Disables a PCC and different types of LSPs under PCC.

description.text: Port handle.

Specifies the parent node/object handle on which the pcep configuration should be configured. In case of create/modify -mode, -handle generally denotes the parent node/object handle . In case of modes modify/delete/disable/enable -handle denotes the object node handle on which the action needs to be performed.
If Stateful PCE Capability is enabled then this control should be activated to set the update capability in the Stateful PCE Capability TLV.
The SR PCE Capability TLV is an optional TLV associated with the OPEN Object to exchange SR capability of PCEP speakers.
Maximum SID Depth field (MSD) specifies the maximum number of SIDs that a PCC is capable of imposing on a packet. Editable only if SR PCE Capability is enabled.
PPAG TLV Type specifies PCC's capability of interpreting this type of PPAG TLV
IPv4 address of the PCE. This column is greyed out in case of PCCv6.
Step argument for IPv4 address of the PCE.
Max LSPs Per PCReq
Controls the maximum LSP information that can be present in a Path report message when the session is stateful session.
Frequency/Time Interval of sending PCEP messages to keep the session active.
This is the time interval, after the expiration of which, a PCEP peer declares the session down if no PCEP message has been received.
This is the time interval, after the expiration of which, LSP is cleaned up by PCC.
This is the time interval, after the expiration of which, retry to establish the broken session by PCC happen.
This is the maximum time interval, by which recoonect timer will be increased upto.
If enabled, then PCC will reply PCErr upon receiving PCInitiate message.
To configure the type of error. Editable only if Return Instantiation Error is enabled.
The type of cryptographic authentication to be used on this link interface
A value to be used as the "secret" MD5 Key.
Requested LSPs per PCC
Pre-Established SR LSPs per PCC
Active Pre Established LSps
Based on the value in this control the number of Expected Initiated LSPs for Traffic can be configured. This is used for traffic only.
Number of Backup PCEs
The rate control is an optional feature associated with PCE initiated LSP.
Interval in milisecond in which desired rate of messages needs to be maintained.
Maximum number of LSP computation request messages can be sent per interval.
Maximum number of LSP sync can be sent per interval.
Activate/Deactivate Configuration
Name of NGPF element, guaranteed to be unique in Scenario
This is used for generating the traffic for those LSPs from PCE for which the Symbolic Path Name is configured and matches the value.
This is used to set the Source IPv4 address in the IP header of the generated traffic.
Step argument for Source IPv4 address in the IP header of the generated traffic.
This is used to set the Source IPv6 address in the IP header of the generated traffic.
Step argument for Source IPv6 address in the IP header of the generated traffic.
This control is used to set the maximum Segment count/ MPLS labels that would be present in the generted traffic.
Insert IPv6 Explicit Null MPLS header if the traffic type is of type IPv6
Activate/Deactivate configuration for Expected PCE Initiated SR LSPs for Traffic
Include RP
Include End Points
Include LSPA
Include Bandwidth
Include Metric
Include IRO
Include XRO

Initial Delegation
LSP "P" Flag
Override PLSP-ID

An identifier for the LSP. A PCC creates a unique PLSP-ID for each LSP that is constant for the lifetime of a PCEP session. The PCC will advertise the same PLSP-ID on all PCEP sessions it maintains at a given time.
Include Symbolic Path Name TLV
Symbolic Path Name
The period of time a PCC waits for, when a PCEP session is terminated, before revoking LSP delegation to a PCE and attempting to redelegate LSPs associated with the terminated PCEP session to PCE.
LSPA "P" Flag
Setup Priority
Holding Priority
Local Protection
Include Any
Include All
Exclude Any
Bandwidth "P" Flag
Bandwidth (bits/sec)
Max Number of Metrics
IRO "P" Flag
Max Number of IRO Sub Objects
XRO "P" Flag
Fail Bit
Max Number of IRO Sub Objects
Specifies whether that specific Data Traffic Endpoint will generate data traffic
Source IPv4 Address
Step argument of Source IPv4 Address
Source IPv6 Address
Step argument of Source IPv6 Address
This control is used to set the maximum Segment count/ MPLS labels that would be present in the generted traffic.
Insert IPv6 Explicit Null MPLS header if the traffic type is of type IPv6
Activate/Deactivate PCC Requested SR LSPs
Activate/Deactivate IRO
Sub Object Type
Prefix Length
IPv4 Address

Router ID

Interface ID
AS Number
Controls whether the XRO sub-object will be sent in the PCRequest message.
XRO "P" Flag
Indicates whether the exclusion is mandatory or desired.
Indicates how the exclusion subobject is to be indicated.
Using the Sub Object Type control user can configure which sub object needs to be included from the following options: IPv4 Prefix, IPv6 Prefix, Unnumbered Interface ID, AS Number and SRLG.
Prefix Length
IPv4 Address
Step argument of IPv4 Address
IPv6 Address

Router ID

Interface ID
AS Number
SRLG ID
32 bit PKS ID
128 bit PKS ID
Activate/Deactivate Metric
Metric "P" Flag
Metric Type
Metric Value
C Flag
B Flag
Indicates whether SRP object will be included in a PCInitiate message. All other attributes in sub-tab-SRP would be editable only if this checkbox is enabled.
Indicates whether LSP will be included in a PCInitiate message. All other attributes in sub-tab-LSP would be editable only if this checkbox is enabled.
Specifies whether ERO is active or inactive. All subsequent attributes of the sub-tab-ERO would be editable only if this is enabled.
Indicates whether the PCInitiate message will have the metric list that is configured. All subsequent attributes of the sub-tab-Metric would be editable only if this is enabled.
Indicates whether Bandwidth will be included in a PCInitiate message. All other attributes in sub-tab-Bandwidth would be editable only if this checkbox is enabled.
Indicates whether LSPA will be included in a PCInitiate message. All other attributes in sub-tab-LSPA would be editable only if this checkbox is enabled.
Initial Delegation
Indicates if PLSP-ID will be set by the state machine or user. If disabled user wont have the control and state machine will set it.

An identifier for the LSP. A PCC creates a unique PLSP-ID for each LSP that is constant for the lifetime of a PCEP session. The PCC will advertise the same PLSP-ID on all PCEP sessions it maintains at a given time.
Indicates if Symbolic-Path-Name TLV is to be included in PCInitiate message.

Each LSP (path) must have a symbolic name that is unique in the PCC. It must remain constant throughout a path's lifetime, which may span across multiple consecutive PCEP sessions and/or PCC restarts.
Destination IPv4 Address
The period of time a PCC waits for, when a PCEP session is terminated, before revoking LSP delegation to a PCE and attempting to redelegate LSPs associated with the terminated PCEP session to PCE.
Indicates if TE-PATH-BINDING TLV is to be included in PCInitiate message.
Indicates the type of binding included in the TLV. Types are as follows: 20bit MPLS Label 32bit MPLS Label. Default value is 20bit MPLS Label.
This control will be editable if the Binding Type is set to either 20bit or 32bit MPLS-Label. This field will take the 20bit value of the MPLS-Label
This field is used to carry traffic class information. This control will be editable only if Binding Type is MPLS Label 32bit.

This bit is set to True for the last entry in the label stack i.e., for the bottom of the stack, and False for all other label stack entries. This control will be editable only if Binding Type is MPLS Label 32bit.
This field is used to encode a time-to-live value. This control will be editable only if Binding Type is MPLS Label 32bit.
Value that indicates the number of ERO Sub Objects to be configured.
Value that indicates the number of Metric Objects to be configured.
Bandwidth (bits/sec)
The priority of the LSP with respect to taking resources.The value 0 is the highest priority.The Setup Priority is used in deciding whether this session can preempt another session.
The priority of the LSP with respect to holding resources. The value 0 is the highest priority. Holding Priority is used in deciding whether this session can be preempted by another session.
When set, this means that the path must include links protected with Fast Reroute
This is a type of Resource Affinity Procedure that is used to validate a link. This control accepts a link if the link carries any of the attributes in the set.
This is a type of Resource Affinity Procedure that is used to validate a link. This control excludes a link from consideration if the link carries any of the attributes in the set.
This is a type of Resource Affinity Procedure that is used to validate a link. This control accepts a link only if the link carries all of the attributes in the set.
Indicates whether Association will be included in a Sync PCReport message. All other attributes in sub-tab-PPAG would be editable only if this checkbox is enabled.
The Association ID of this LSP.
Indicates whether Protection LSP Bit is On.
Indicates whether Standby LSP Bit is On.
Specifies whether that specific Data Traffic Endpoint will generate data traffic
Source IPv4 address
Step argument of Source IPv4 address
Source IPv6 address
Step argument of Source IPv4 address
Insert IPv6 Explicit Null MPLS header if the traffic type is of type IPv6
Activate/Deactivate Pre-Established SR LSPs
Controls whether the ERO sub-object will be sent in the PCInitiate message.
Indicates if user wants to represent a loose-hop sub object in the LSP
Using the Sub Object Type control user can configure which sub object needs to be included from the following options: Not Applicable, IPv4 Prefix, IPv6 Prefix, AS Number.
Prefix Length
IPv4 Prefix is specified as an IPv4 address.
Step Argument of IPv4 Prefix.
IPv6 Prefix is specified as an IPv6 address.
Step Argument of IPv6 Prefix.
AS Number

Using the Segment Identifier Type control user can configure whether to include SID or not and if included what is its type. Types are as follows: Null, SID, 20bit MPLS Label, 32bit MPLS Label. If it is Null then S bit is set in the packet. Default value is 20bit MPLS Label.
SID is the Segment Identifier
This control will be editable if the SID Type is set to either 20bit or 32bit MPLS-Label. This field will take the 20bit value of the MPLS-Label
This field is used to carry traffic class information. This control will be editable only if SID Type is MPLS Label 32bit.

This bit is set to true for the last entry in the label stack i.e., for the bottom of the stack, and false for all other label stack entries. This control will be editable only if SID Type is MPLS Label 32bit.
This field is used to encode a time-to-live value. This control will be editable only if SID Type is MPLS Label 32bit.

NAI (Node or Adjacency Identifier) contains the NAI associated with the SID. Depending on the value of SID Type, the NAI can have different formats such as: Not Applicable, IPv4 Node ID, IPv6 Node ID, IPv4 Adjacency, IPv6 Adjacency, Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs

restriction.value: notapplicable ipv4nodeid ipv6nodeid ipv4adjacency ipv6adjacency unnumberedadjacencywithipv4nodeids

description.text: A Flag which is used to carry additional information pertaining to SID. When this bit is set, the NAI value in the subobject body is null.
IPv4 Node ID is specified as an IPv4 address. This control can be configured if NAI Type is set to IPv4 Node ID and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of IPv4 Node ID
IPv6 Node ID is specified as an IPv6 address. This control can be configured if NAI Type is set to IPv6 Node ID and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of IPv6 Node ID
This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to IPv4 Adjacency and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of Local IPv4 Address
This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to IPv4 Adjacency and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of Remote IPv4 Address
This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to IPv6 Adjacency and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of Local IPv6 Address
This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to IPv6 Adjacency and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of Remote IPv6 Address

This is the Local Node ID of the Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs which is specified as a pair of Node ID / Interface ID tuples. This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of Local Node ID

This is the Local Interface ID of the Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs which is specified as a pair of Node ID / Interface ID tuples. This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs and F bit is disabled.

This is the Remote Node ID of the Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs which is specified as a pair of Node ID / Interface ID tuples. This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs and F bit is disabled.
Step argument of Remote Node ID

This is the Remote Interface ID of the Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs which is specified as a pair of Node ID / Interface ID tuples. This Control can be configured if NAI Type is set to Unnumbered Adjacency with IPv4 NodeIDs and F bit is disabled.
Specifies whether the corresponding metric object is active or not.
This is a drop down which has 4 choices: IGP/ TE/ Hop count/ MSD.
User can specify the metric value corresponding to the metric type selected.
B (bound) flag MUST be set in the METRIC object, which specifies that the SID depth for the computed path MUST NOT exceed the metric-value.
IPv4 address of the backup PCE. This column is greyed out in case of PCCv6.
Activate/Deactivate Configuration

returnValue.value: A list containing the ipv4 loopback protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ipv4 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
When status is $::FAILURE, log shows the detailed information of failure.
Handle of Expected PCE Initiated SR LSPs configured
Handle of PCC Requested SR LSPs configured
Handle of Pre-Established SR LSPs configured
